comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: Another view of two of the real Fokker D.VII aircraft used in the filming of Howard Hugh's picture, "Hell's Angels." The flying sequences in this film were described by British Sopwith Camel ace Capt. Arthur Gould-Lee as being the most accurate as to the way that they flew. The Blue Max sequences, he said, were too calm and not how they flew. He said that "Hell's Angels" was more like it.
